revised_title: Radius Renormalization in Limit Cycles: A New Approach
tldr: The authors present a new method to study limit cycles in nonlinear oscillations using the normal forms method. They show that by choosing the zero-order term in the perturbation expansion, the radius of the limit cycle can be unaffected by higher-order corrections. This simplifies the calculation of the basic frequency of oscillations and avoids the need to update the radius of the limit circle in higher orders of the perturbation expansion.
